DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Our plan is going really well so far!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: I know, right? If things continue going perfectly like they are now, we won't have anything to worry about!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: I just want to say that I really love you right now :)

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Who are you talking to?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: You, of course. There's nobody else here.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Are you sure there's nobody else here? Well anyways, let's keep moving on to the next floor up the tower.
#F3C14CFF Use the arrow keys to explore the tower and find the staircase up to the next floor. Be on the lookout for treasure chests on the way.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Oh! A sarcophagus! What do you think is inside? Maybe treasure or just a dead body?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Do you want to open it up?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Um.. no.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Yeah, it's probably for the best.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Let's do it!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Hmph... give me a hand with this, will ya?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Oof, it's not budging even a little.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Forget it, probably not worth the trouble.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Mmm... maybe... ?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: What kind of decision is that?! That's basically the same thing as saying no, so let's just forget about it.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: What are these things doing here?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: If they were placed inside of treasure chests, they must have been precious to somebody.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Do you think we should wear these?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: I have no idea, I'm just a fool.
#F3C14CFF Press the ESC key to bring up the main menu. Navigate to the 'Equip' menu to assign newly discovered equipment to your party.
#F3C14CFF Equippable items will not provide any benefit to your party unless equipped through this menu.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Um... can we circle back to something you said earlier about us not being alone here?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Look behind you! So there -is- someone here! That must be a qliphoth. I've heard about them before.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: They're supposed to be dangerous, but that one doesn't look so tough.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: This isn't supposed to happen. I don't like the look of this.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: We can easily beat it if you work together with me.
#F3C14CFF Battle is initiated upon contact with wandering qliphoths. Avoid them if necessary, or fight them to gain experience points.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Oh no, what's happening to the sun?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Something is blotting it all out... this must be a really bad omen!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Watch out! A really powerful qliphoth is coming this way!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: I'm still good... I can keep fighting...

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: I hate you...
Many lifetimes later...
Empires rise and fall... the cycle repeats itself. And every year, the corruption spreads further from the cursed tower.
Investigating a mysterious connection to the tower, an imperial scholar charters an airship to a remote cave in the Forest of Giants...

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Set me down right here, pilot. I can see the cave just ahead.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sidney
DialogueRecords.Text: Yessir.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sidney
DialogueRecords.Text: It's too risky for me to loiter here with the airship. When do you want me to come back, sir?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: I suppose I'll need a day to finish looking everything over. I'll camp overnight and you can return this time tomorrow morning.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sidney
DialogueRecords.Text: Sounds like a plan. Please be careful, sir.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: It's too soon for the airship to return just yet. I should return to the manaspring cave and camp there overnight for safety.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: How remarkable, mana is pooling up almost to the surface here! The source of the mana must be somewhere below.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: I'm sure this mana source must be related to the tower, somehow...
#2CE32CFF MP restored!
#F3C14CFF This is a save point. While standing here, you may save your game progress through the main menu.
#F3C14CFF You may also save your game progress any time while on the overworld map.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Hmph, I knew there would be dangerous wildlife down here. I don't really want to disturb them if possible.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: But I can't let anything get in the way of my investigation either.
Hello. Been expecting you.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Pardon me? I don't believe we've been introduced before.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Your name is Sparr Adams. I'm Envi, chief of the Morrigan tribe. Saw your arrival in a dream.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Well, this is certainly unexpected and not what I was looking for... but, I admit you have my attention. Please tell me more.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Not tell. Show. Follow me to the back of this cavern.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Ha ha, very well! Please, lead the way.

Name: SwordDare

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: You've already been down here, right? Why are you still using that club when there's a free sword right there?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Don't need it. Like my club better.

EndScript: Case Insist on getting the sword

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: I insist, a warrior should have a sword. At the very least you could throw it at the bats if we run out of darts.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: If you care that much... okay. Didn't expect fighting when I came up here, but now I feel danger. Maybe I'll take it.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: The animals seem more restless now. More of them, too.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Is that unusual? It was like this in the upper tunnels of the cave while I made my way down here.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: That's the magic source I was searching for! I've never seen such a large crystal occur naturally before.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: So you were leading me to it this whole time. For a moment I thought you just wanted... never mind.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: I'll have to move this carefully to the cave entrance. When the airship returns I'll request a excavation team.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Touch the crystal.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Not so fast. These things are more delicate than they look.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.0
DialogueRecords.Text: Touch crystal!

DialogueRecords.Speaker: $Party.1
DialogueRecords.Text: Right, right, calm down. I'll just make a quick inspection up close...
#F3C14CFF To be continued...
#F3C14CFF Thank you for playing my game jam entry! This concludes all the game content for now.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: What just happened... ?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Fool
DialogueRecords.Text: If I am you, and you am I, who decides who gets to drive?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: I don't understand anything you just said. You look very familiar, though.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Fool
DialogueRecords.Text: That's too bad, I spent a lot of time thinking that one up. I thought you'd get it for sure.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Fool
DialogueRecords.Text: Actually, I've spent a lot of time thinking about things. So do you want me to take over for a bit?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: I'm not sure what you mean by that, but I don't want you taking over anything.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Fool
DialogueRecords.Text: Okay, fine, just thought I'd offer. Let me know if you change your mind. Or if you want to change minds.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: You look like you know what's going on here.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Hunter
DialogueRecords.Text: One of us needs to. Have you figured out yet who spawned all the qliphoths in this cave?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: There are no qliphoths here. I made a thorough inspection and found native fauna in abundance, as expected.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Hunter
DialogueRecords.Text: Everything you fought since disembarking your flying machine has been a qliphoth.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Hunter
DialogueRecords.Text: If you lack mental discipline, the crystal can make your preconceptions real in the worst way.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Hunter
DialogueRecords.Text: Please let me lead us for a while. I'll set us in the right direction while you keep figuring things out.

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Sparr
DialogueRecords.Text: Is this a possession, then? Whom exactly am I speaking with?

DialogueRecords.Speaker: Hunter
DialogueRecords.Text: That's not quite it. And what was that dumb quip you made to Envi
All abilities restored to maximum charges!
